snippet.title: How to install React in 2023 - new react.dev Website
snippet.description:
Are you interested in learning React JS from scratch but not sure how to get started? In this video tutorial, I'll walk you through the process of installing React JS according to the brand new react.dev website. Whether you're a complete beginner or already have some coding experience, this step-by-step guide will help you set up your environment and start building React applications in no time.

By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of how to install and set up React JS, and be ready to start building your own React applications. Whether you want to create a simple website or a complex web app, React JS is a powerful tool that can help you achieve your goals. So, let's get started and learn how to install React JS today!

My complete React Tutorial series - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5Xy-t8k_M4A&list=PLHiZ4m8vCp9M6HVQv7a36cp8LKzyHIePr

snippet.title: #45 React Router DOM v6 Bangla Tutorial - Breaking Changes - React Router 6 vs 5
snippet.description:
In this React Router DOM v6 Bangla tutorial, you will learn how to install react router dom 6, what are the breaking changes in react router 6, difference between react router 6 vs 5, how to upgrade from react router v5 to react router v6. 
Previously, I provided a detail Bangla Tutorial on React Router DOM but that was based on React Router version 5. You will get that tutorial link from below.

üëç React Tutorial Series in Bangla: https://lwsbd.link/react
üëç GitHub Repository: https://github.com/learnwithsumit/think-in-a-react-way [ branch: lesson-45]

** You will get the source code of the initial React Router DOM v5 example shown in the video from the same repository - branch: router-5

References:

snippet.title: React 18 new features - What's new in React
snippet.description:
React 18 will include out-of-the-box improvements (like automatic batching), new APIs (like startTransition), and a new streaming server renderer with built-in support for React.lazy. In this video, I have tried to explain 3 of the coolest features of React that would revolutionize the way we build React applications.  

‚ñ£ This video is highly inspired by the amazing review video by "evening kid" - https://youtu.be/bpVRWrrfM1M. I tried to explain the same with my own words in Bengali language.

References:

‚ñ£ Introducing React 18 - https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/4
‚ñ£ Installing React 18 Release Candidate (RC) - https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/9
‚ñ£ Automatic Batching - https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/21
‚ñ£ New Suspense SSR Architecture - https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/37
‚ñ£ Transitions in React 18 - https://github.com/reactwg/react-18/discussions/41
‚ñ£ Transitions in React 18 - https://reactjs.org/blog/2021/06/08/the-plan-for-react-18.html
